intro: Angostura taubertiana, commonly known as the Taubert's angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
